page.title: 13INTERESTING PEOPLE (B)
page.content: Miss Ray Cook, a recently retired school teacher is daughter of Winifred Cook, nee Watkins, the policeman's daughter one of the few girls who escaped domestic service by attending the Girls High School in Brackley. She was born in 1887 and at the turn of the century usually made the 2\ mile journey on foot. Her marriage to Reginald Cook led to her inheriting the village post office and shop still the only one in Westbury though with very little for sale today.In the 1920's Mr.Cook not only sold provisions, he would also kill one of the 2 pigs which most villagers kept. Alf Robinson was born in 1904 and attended the village school at the age of 3.Having worked on farms in his spare time from the age of 10, it was natural to continue there full time when he left school at the age of 13.
